QID144: I definitely behaved similarly in the driving simulator as I would in real life. I will say that the driving simulator gas and brake pedals were far more sensitive than that of a real vehicle, causing ,e to accelerate and decelerate much more quickly than I would in real life. Thus, I had trouble sticking to the 25 mph speed limit. Additionally, the speeds in the simulator felt far lower than what the speedometer said. For example, 25 mph in the simulation felt like 10 mph in real life, while 50 mph in the simulation felt like 30 mph in real life. Overall, I don't feel like this simulation adequately represented my real life driving skills, as these inconsistencies caused me to feel somewhat disoriented.

QID144: The driving simulator responded similarly to an experience driving an electric vehicle. The car decelerates and accelerates much faster and at a consistent velocity than a typical gas powered vehicle that I typically use. It may be interesting to implement different vehicle types, ie. suv, sedans, electric,etc. and match participants with a familiar type as much of the early driving experience is getting familiar with how the vehicle operates which may induce additional stress in testers
